evening: I install the nvidia graphics driver from the site, which works nicely. but every time I restart, I have to install it again just to get X to run!
how to I get it to stick?
because you used the nvidia.com drivers you dont get the benefit of it autoworking, like with nvidia-glx
so you most likely need to tell your /etc/modules file to load nvidia on boot up
so do I just reinstall nvidia-glx?
that would complicate things more Murrlin
nvidia-glx or nvidia-glx-new is ubuntu packaged drivers for nvidia cards
but you choose to install the ones from nvidia.com , that do not install a deb file, or get used by apt/synaptic
so you have to manually cater for it
installing the driver loads the nvidia module at the end, so when you reboot the module isn't loading automatically
so as per the manual Murrlin , edit /etc/modules , add nvidia to a new line at the end
so next time you reboot, it will add the driver for you
